video

This template will discover all available Linux services using command 'systemctl list-unit-files'.

Zabbix will query each service using command 'systemctl status service-name'.

Zabbix will use preprocessing and extract some attributes of each service

  • active: running|dead|starting|exited
  • service is enabled at startup: yes|no
  • has condition (triggered start): yes|no

Everything will be stored in a database as a numeric value.

Triggers

  • Service "{#NAME}" is not running but configured at startup
  • Service "{#NAME}" is running but not enabled at startup
  • Service "{#NAME}" is not completely started in last {$SERVICE_STARTUP_WINDOW}

Install UserParameter

cd /etc/zabbix/zabbix_agentd.d
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catonrug/zabbix_agentd.d/master/service_monitoring_via_systemctl.conf > service_monitoring_via_systemctl.conf

Restart Zabbix agent

systemctl restart zabbix-agent

Test if the discovery item works

zabbix_agentd -t services.systemctl

Import template

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catonrug/zabbix_agentd.d/master/service_monitoring_via_systemctl.xml

Open host configuration, assign template "service monitoring using systemctl"

Tested on

  • CentOS 7
  • Raspbian 9

Not working on

  • CentOS 6
features: Low Level Discovery (LLD)|Zabbix Agent|Zabbix Agent Active|Dependent Items
